pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [3dbbc13e41](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16503/commits/3dbbc13e4142fe51c02fda451eaa1586ab096f53)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.ModelTheory.Algebra.Ring.MvPolynomial`|1023|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ MvPolynomialSupportLEEquiv_symm_apply_coeff`
`+ genericPolyMap`
`+ lift_genericPolyMap`
`+ mvPolynomialSupportLEEquiv`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I can see how this is about to be useful in defining terms in the language of rings, but there's no actual logic in this yet, as you can see from the imports. In fact, looking at #16504, it looks like this file isn't going to need to include any logic at all - the necessary connections to logical terms are already in other files.

Should this be moved nearer where `FreeCommRing` or `MvPolynomial` is defined and worked with?

> @ChrisHughes24 What do you think of the suggestion by awainverse to move this file out of `ModelTheory/`?

I think it's a good idea. It is a bit model-theory specific - the whole point of doing families of polynomials is that a First Order Formula might contain multiple ring expressions. But yes it probably ideally belongs elsewhere.
@ChrisHughes24 Just to make sure we're on the same page: you're still planning to move this out of `ModelTheory/` right?
@ChrisHughes24 What do you think of the suggestion by awainverse to move this file out of `ModelTheory/`?
@ChrisHughes24 What do you think of the suggestion by awainverse to move this file out of `ModelTheory/`?

```suggestion
/-- Given a finite set of monomials `monoms : ι → Finset (κ →₀ ℕ)`, the
```

```suggestion
    FreeCommRing.lift f (genericPolyMap monoms i) =
      MvPolynomial.eval (f ∘ Sum.inr)
        (((mvPolynomialSupportLEEquiv monoms).symm
```

```suggestion
    (f : (i : ι) × { x // x ∈ monoms i } ⊕ κ → R) (i : ι) :
```

pullRequest.title: feat(ModelTheory): Turning polynomials into ring terms

source.title: feat(ModelTheory): Definability of `zeroLocus` in the language of rings

nodes.body:
I can see how this is about to be useful in defining terms in the language of rings, but there's no actual logic in this yet, as you can see from the imports. In fact, looking at #16504, it looks like this file isn't going to need to include any logic at all - the necessary connections to logical terms are already in other files.

Should this be moved nearer where `FreeCommRing` or `MvPolynomial` is defined and worked with?
@ChrisHughes24 What do you think of the suggestion by awainverse to move this file out of `ModelTheory/`?

> @ChrisHughes24 What do you think of the suggestion by awainverse to move this file out of `ModelTheory/`?

I think it's a good idea. It is a bit model-theory specific - the whole point of doing families of polynomials is that a First Order Formula might contain multiple ring expressions. But yes it probably ideally belongs elsewhere.
@ChrisHughes24 Just to make sure we're on the same page: you're still planning to move this out of `ModelTheory/` right?
